alert.note: Alert for Cotton; Jefferson (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 1:47PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Jefferson, southeastern Cotton, northern Clay, northeastern Archer and southeastern Wichita Counties through 215 PM CST... At 147 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Wichita Falls, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita Falls, Burkburnett, Henrietta, Iowa Park, Holliday, Petrolia, Scotland, Byers, Dean, Windthorst, Jolly, Lake Arrowhead, Sheppard AFB, Lakeside City, Pleasant Valley, Charlie and Cashion. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
